subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 1845
msgSnippet: ... I share this concern and I am trying to ascertain whether it is marketed this way or if it is a misunderstanding on the part of those being marketed to. My
messageBody:
On 6/1/06, Robert Martin <UncleBob@...> wrote:

>
> Moreover I fear a tool that can figure out tests for you may give
> developers an excuse not to write their own tests; especially if it
> is marketed to managers and developers as a way to reduce unit test
> writing time.


I share this concern and I am trying to ascertain whether it is marketed
this way or if it is a misunderstanding on the part of those being marketed
to. My feeling is that it is the *later* as I attended a presentation on
developer testing by Jeff from Agitar and there was very little talk of the
tool. Possibly the misunderstanding came from local marketing and local
inexperience?

Whenever we have been discussing developer testing here I get the impression
that some think the tool will solve the problems for them ... it will do the
'"testing". I (and others) have been reiterating that developer testing is
an attitude and usually requires a change in culture more than a change in
toolset.

Regards
Shane


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
